text: Trump will be at the summit of g20
Nations in Hamburg tomorrow where he and
Vladimir Putin are expected to hold
their first face-to-face meeting
diplomatic correspondent James Robbins
is there in Hamburg for us now and James
at present Trump got a warm reception in
Poland but things could be a lot more
tense at the summit I think it will be a
pretty testing few days for President
Trump here in Hamburg I can't really
remember that build-up to one of these
global summits where the atmosphere has
been so fractured between the leaders
and I think that's inevitable when you
acknowledge that President Trump is if
you like shedding some america's
leadership role talking about America
first moving away from a global rules
based system his first test here will be
a meeting with the summit host
Chancellor Angela Merkel she's very
angry with him frankly for America's
decision his decision to walk away from
the Paris climate change agreement and
she's going to insist to him that
climate change remains one of her
absolute priorities for this meeting so
that's going to be a testing start and
then reflecting what we've been hearing
from Warsaw tomorrow
president Trump is going to have his
first ever encounter as president with
Vladimir Putin and I think that's going
to be the prizefight of this summit why
do I say that well of course because
president Trump has today been talking
about Russia as being disruptive
particularly in the Ukraine and he's
been acknowledging more openly that I
think than ever before that Russia in
his words may have been responsible for
intervention in the American elections
so that's going to be a real humdinger
of a clash James many things James
Robinson
